summary: The research focused on developing methods for synthesizing oligonucleotides, including the use of E. coli polynucleotide phosphorylase for deoxyribooligonucleotide synthesis and model studies to define the stability and specificity of oligonucleotide duplexes.
key_claims: Developed a method using E. coli polynucleotide phosphorylase for synthesizing deoxyribooligonucleotides up to 12-13 nucleotides in length.
Conducted model studies on the stability and specificity of chemically synthesized oligonucleotides.

reaction_types.name: alkaline transesterification
reaction_types.context: Method used for nucleoside-3',5' cyclic phosphate synthesis.

reaction_types.name: chemical synthesis of deoxyribooligonucleotides
reaction_types.context: Used E. coli polynucleotide phosphorylase and Mn2+ with NaCl as substrate.
